item.title: Modifying SQL Server Startup Parameters
item.description: Mike, Mike, Mike, Mike, Mike….guess what I figured out? Well it all started by reading Mike Fal’s post on Managing SQL Server Services with #PowerShell. In that post he goes over manipulating the SQL Server service account and how to update it. In my case I needed to create a script that would let me alter the Startup Parameters. If you go search right now for using PowerShell to alter the startup parameters for SQL Server…go ahead….

item.title: StackDb PowerShell Module
item.description: Maybe you are tired of AdventureWorks or if you are still old school with Northwnd and Pubs? Brent Ozar has for many years now been using [StackOverflow database](“http://www.brentozar.com/archive/2014/01/how-to-query-the-stackexchange-databases/") in his training and demos. As StackExchange (SE) started providing public [archives of the SE network sites](“https://archive.org/details/stackexchange"). I wanted to be able to build out a sample database on all of these archives as I needed, so wrote a PowerShell module.
